managementResponses.response:
Thank you for being our guest, and we appreciate your candid. We are sorry the inconvenience you experienced at our hotel. We will work hard with our team members to ensure we deliver excellent customer service to all our guests. We value your comments and hope to have another opportunity of welcoming you back soon. 

Yours in Hospitality, 
Rhodora Escobar 
General Manager

review.reviewText:
Bathroom counter was unusually small for two people. Also, no mirror in the room. After requesting a mirror, they brought a full sized one in & placed it up against the wall. 
Restaurant service closed earlier than it was supposed to, so we were disappointed about that. 
We had to pay for parking on the property. That should be part of the room cost.

review.title: nice hotel close to airport
review.reviewText: warm and friendly staff to greet you as soon as you walk in. rooms were clean I would stay there again . the only thing I didn't like was that they had no breakfast included with the stay.
review.negativeRemarks: they should offer free breakfast

review.reviewText: Great location near freeway and airport.  Rooms on the freeway side are a bit noisy with the traffic, but double windows block out a lot of it.  Good free coffee in the morning.  Breakfast available, and there are several easy restaurants (IHOP) right nearby.  Staff was friendly and helpful.  Enjoyed the room.

Close to the airport but noisy
Didn't like the parking fee

review.title: Solid Hotel near Airport
review.reviewText: This is your typical hotel near airport.  It is a bit older,
review.positiveRemarks: The front desk staff was lovely.
review.negativeRemarks: Air conditioner was confusing to work,  Duvets with down filled quilts are too hot for me to sleep under,  I prefer light cotton blanket.

review.title: Series of Unfortunate Events
review.reviewText: Stayed for a week! AC was leaking all over carpet and the bathroom was not cleaned properly upon my arrival. Also, there were limited items available for breakfast. The front desk is very difficult to get ahold of and they don't monitor their guests very well. There were several parties on our floor and the entire floor/our room reaked of marijuana one night. To no surprise - the entire hotel was evacuated due to the fire alarms going off at 12am. During this time there was no communication to the guests about what was going on! No one even told us it was safe to return to our rooms.  We would not stay again!

review.title: Very comfortable and staff was friendly.
review.reviewText:
Check in was a breeze. The room
Was very clean. Accessibility to San Jose and San Francisco... SFO Int'l Airport was within reach.

review.title: Nice hotel close to SFO airport.
review.reviewText: The hotel room was nice, great staff, comfortable beds, clean showers. A bit of a drive to other destinations, but overall a good stay.

review.title: Convenient hotel
review.reviewText:
Near downtown.
Room is nice but not in good condition. They didn't check their facilities before renting out. We had no AC first day. Got move to another room for the second day. So overall staying rating is not that good. The service is very good.

review.title: There were ants in the room everywhere.
review.reviewText: There were ants in the room on the bed, on the desk and on the counter where the coffee condiments were.  The front desk and telephone operator were notified but no one came to the room to check it out.  There was no manager on duty.  The front desk clerk stated that she would inform the manager when he came in.  The maid was notified upon check-out.
review.negativeRemarks: Getting rid of the ants.
review.locationRemarks: Close to San Francisco.

review.title: Hotel by the airport
review.reviewText: I already submitted a review. The hotel walls were dirty and bare. The kitchen in our toom was pathetic. Need more cream and sugar for the coffe bar in the room. Better signs for when room is ready to be cleaned! Cleaning crew came by too early and never came back to clean our room. Overall, I'm disappointed. Will not come back.

review.title: Close to airport.
review.reviewText: Clean, friendly staff, parking cost for each day. Close to airport.

review.title: Do not stay here!
review.reviewText:
There was absolutely nothing to eat when I arrived late at night. And now way to get anything. The air/heat in the room was not working properly and I was freezing. The maintenance man said there was nothing he could do. There was nothing to eat in the morning and no way to get it until too late. 
Staff  uncommunicative (except maintenance guy who was friendly). Front desk hard to reach by phone and completely unconcerned about my comfort.
On the plus side - very close to airport and really good beds.
review.negativeRemarks: Service, service, service. heat. Food.
review.locationRemarks: Nothing to do but get a on a plane. That's the point of this hotel.

review.reviewText: Great big room, soundproofed windows - you cannot hear highway noise. Bus stop with connection to downtown SF right in front of the hotel. Order hamburger, it's delicious. Shuttle to the airport. Friendly stuff.
Very comfortable and close to the airport. Room was clean and staff was really polite. Definitely would go back.

review.title: Nice hotel close to airport
review.reviewText:
We only stayed overnight because we had an early flight and this location was right down the road from the rental car return. It was great though because there was a gas station right next door. Only downside is that you have to pay for parking even though there is no special garage or anything. Room was very clean. The bartender was very unresponsive though. My wife and I sat at the bar for five minutes before being greeted and then asked for a dessert menu and didn't see her again for another five minutes, so we gave up. 

Nice hotel for a quite stay for a flight out of San Francisco though.
review.negativeRemarks: Having to pay for parking is ridiculous since there is no gate or covering.
review.locationRemarks: Airport is close by.

review.title: Convenient - close to conference center
review.reviewText: Arrived late - I got the feeling things were not quite as they should be at the front desk.  I know they were overbooked as they gave me someone else's room.  The manager told the desk clerk to go ahead and re-assign as my room was prepaid.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel, a Sheraton Four Points, I would say met the minimum requirements.  It was a little "tired" and in need of renovations.
review.locationRemarks: I only visited the conference center.

review.title: Right off the Freeway
review.reviewText: Located in South San Fransico, it is right off the freeway. Easy to reach the hotel and easy to hit the road for the city. The shuttle was always on time, and the staff was excellent.
review.negativeRemarks: WiFi always booted me off.

review.title: Dismal Location, Food and Service
review.reviewText:
This hotel is very near the airport and is located on a strip of similar hotels. The highway runs directly behind this hotel. Be aware that you have to pay extra for parking if you have a car. 

The decor inside is tired and my room, particularly the bathroom, could have been cleaner. There was scuff marks/dirt all along the inside door to my bathroom and the smoke detector was hanging by its wires from the ceiling.
review.negativeRemarks: The food served by the restaurant was terrible. The service at breakfast was slow & inattentive. The evening server was rude to customers at closing.
review.locationRemarks: Not much is nearby in terms of restaurants. There's a McDonald's down the street.

review.title: It is right on the busiest highway.
review.reviewText: Very noisy, not very clean. There where animal and other people's hair on the bedding and on the towels. Dirtier than I expected, I felt as wearing my shoes in a room since the carpet felt sticky and filthy. Streaks of dirt on the bathroom door, the bathroom door was't staying open, something was wrong with the spring. I will not stay there again. Very noisy, not soundproof.
review.locationRemarks: Airport, Costco, exit to the main highway.

review.title: Beautiful hotel with 2 storey
review.reviewText: Feel comfortable hotel is clean staff are friendly

review.title: Great Offer, Near DTSF
review.reviewText: Stayed here for a weekend. Check-In and Check-Out were fairly easy, room was comfortable. Confused where the AC switch was, so was cold all night but thats just a personal mistake rather than the hotel. Staff was friendly, will consider staying here again next time i visit SF

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText: Disappointed in hotel,  room was dirty,  stains on bed linen. They came and changed it and gave us a free breakfast but the food was not good. There were still stains on the couch and walls. Bathtub was not cleaned well.  I wouldn't consider this 3 stars and won't stay there again.

review.title: Have a backup plan for breakfast.
review.reviewText: We were told breakfast would be available starting at 6:30am.  We tried at 6:40 and were told the woman that sets up was late and they needed 10 more minutes.  We gave them until 7 before giving up.  They apologized, but come on, your entire operation hinges on one person?  3 people at the front desk and no one was cross trained?  Too bad, I was going to give them a 5 out of 5.

Decent hotel. 
They deserve more stars.
Clean and cozy.

review.title: Very nice place to stay, very clean.
review.reviewText: Had a great experience at this hotel; it met all my expectations and more.

review.title: Dirty blankets
review.reviewText: On our way back to Texas fromYosemite, We stayed one night in this hotel for its proximity to the airport as we had an early morning flight the next day. We were fine with the hotel until we discovered some brown stains on the blanket on our way out. Gross!

review.title: Nice hotel close to airport
review.reviewText: The room is clean but kind of dark.  Not enough light for the kids to read.  Parking is extra cost.  Not including breakfast but there's a McDonalds close by.

review.title: Close to the airport.
review.reviewText: I had a meeting at the airport, so it was close and thus convenient.
review.negativeRemarks: A ramp from the front door to the desk would be a huge improvement.  If you park out front, there are 4 or 5 steep steps to drag luggage up.

review.title: Nice, clean hotel for an overnight stay.
review.reviewText:
This hotel seems to have been recently updated.  The lobby and room were nicely decorated.  Even though the location was near a highway, I heard no noise and slept quite nicely.  The black out curtains were very helpful.  
I would say the only down fall would be the location.  It is convenient right across the SF Conference Center.  I ate at the restaurant downstairs for dinner and breakfast and found the food better than expected but would have liked more choice within walking distance.   The staff were very cheerful and helpful.  Overall, my stay was quite pleasant.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was nearly redecorated and quite clean.  It had all the basic amenities for the price point.
review.negativeRemarks: Can't do much about the location.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is across one of the SF Conference Center.  Very convenient to get onto the freeway.  Did not explore area much.

review.title: Great location for SFO.  So friendly.
review.reviewText:
Smaller hotel near SFO (Bart station at International Terminal and free bus service from hotel to SFO every 30 minutes.) While we had a challenge of two with our room, the staff was so gracious and concerned, it mattered not.

I would not recommend flying into OAK and staying here - logistically exhausting.
review.positiveRemarks: Every member of the staff was so friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: A little love in the QC area - our hairdryer was broken and when we picked up a new one on our way upstairs, it was not usable - int'l plug.
review.locationRemarks: Great location near SFO.  Very few dining options nearby but hotel restaurant was fairly priced and the food quality was good.

review.title: Close to airport, but that's pretty much it
review.reviewText:
Hotel was OK. My biggest complaint was the mattress and pillow low quality, both of which made it harder to sleep.
The location is close to the airport, but is not really a nice area to walk or ait out.

review.title: Fine Hotel close to airport; especially rental car
review.reviewText: Excellent ; met our expectations; was exactly what we needed to get ready to end a vacation with an early flight east.

review.title: Rest and Relaxation
review.reviewText: I had a great time clean and nice room I'd give it 3.5 stars

It was decent but when I walked in the room for the first time I looked around went to the bathroom opened the toilet and I found a poop and toilet paper in there. Safe to say I probably won't be going back

review.title: Limited food options
review.reviewText: The hotel was fine but I would have liked a better in-house menu and grew tired of the limited food options within walking distance: across the street was the restaurant/bar in the Holliday Inn (which was pretty good but not outstanding) and a Crappy Chinese buffet. Other than that there's just an IHOP and a McDonalds within a few blocks and that was it... For a week stay it got old so next time I will look for somewhere with more food options close by or just stay at the Holiday Inn.

review.title: nice hote close to convention center
review.reviewText:
Hotel was selected for closeness to convention center and on-site restaurant.  It butts up against the freeway and for some the 24 hour car noise would be a problem.  Also, the blind didn't close completely and the darkening blinds could not be closed at all. 
The staff were wonderful, the room was clean and comfortable.  The very small restaurant and bar did offer a delicious pasta dish and great "lemon drop".  
Parking was very convenient and it was easy to walk across the street for a conference I attended. 
Next time, I would do a price comparison with other local hotels in the area.  I had expected a newer, more elegant hotel when I booked this one.
review.positiveRemarks: Good parking, convenient to airport and convention center
review.negativeRemarks:
Fix the drapes and screen to darken the room at night. 
Provide shampoo with the toiletries.
review.locationRemarks: There are several restaurants within driving distance.  It's not a sightseeing area.  Traffic is busy on both the freeway and Airport Blvd..

review.reviewText: Having to walk up the steps with luggages at the main entrance was very inconvenient .

review.title: Nice hotel near the airport
review.reviewText: Came to California on a surprise trip for my girlfriend and we got engaged out here. The staff at the hotel upgraded our room and went above and beyond making us happy!

We were charged $12.00 for parking for one night.   The worst part is we have been charged $100.00 for incidentals that did not exist.   The billing department said they pre-charge and will refund in 5 days.   This has never happened before and we will never stay at the Sheraton again.   The $12.00 has not been charged yet, just $100.00 for nothing.

We hope that it is only $100.00 but will be checking daily.

review.title: Unfriendly staff
review.reviewText:
I booked 2 queen bed non-smoking room for $190 but it was smoking room!!! 
when i was check in front desk guy said we have free breakfast from 6-10 am but he lied. They charged me for that and for parking too!!! You can spend $100 for motel room then this 1star hotel!!!

review.title: Stayed for Waves to Wine Cycling Event
review.reviewText: Very kind and accommodating staff.  Very clean and pleasant atmosphere overall.
review.positiveRemarks: Great Lobby Restaurant and bar.  GOOD COFFEE:)
review.negativeRemarks: NA

review.title: Hot and noisy
review.reviewText:
AC in king room did not work and the solution offered as "open the window".  Hotel is on the 101 near SFO -- not an option.  After long, but polite, discussions with hotel staff.  They did locate a queen room with working AC.  Noise was constant hum in background.  Staff tried to please, but lacked authority to make decision.
We won't be back.  Sheraton needs to visit and provide coaching to ownership.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel is looking and feels tired.  Needs deep clean and sprucing up.
review.locationRemarks: Expressway nearby.

review.title: Water issues
review.reviewText: On our check out day, I guess the hotel was having water issues and took us much longer to get ready but when I called the front desk they sent someone over to look at pipes but didn't do anything. They said it'll be ok, water pressure will come back. Well it didn't and I called the front desk for a late check out and she was not very willing to at least give us a half hour..  Told her what was going on and a she still was hesitant on giving it to us.

When an emergency forced is to check out early, we were told that was up to Expedia.  I called Expedia and they said that they would talk to the Hotel manager and that I would get a refund.  I then received an email message from Expedia that said that the Hotel would not refund for the two nights.  So there you go.  A bad experience.

review.title: nice hotel near SFO
review.reviewText: I always stay here when traveling to SFO. Clean rooms and quiet.

review.title: Close to airport & provided a shuttle bus
review.reviewText: The night before our flights we decided to stay at a hotel neat the airport. Booking online was so easy. The hotel staff was amazing!
review.locationRemarks: Near the airport

review.reviewText: Hotel not close to downtown San Francisco.... Had to drive quite a distance to get to the city and attractions.  Convenient to the interstate and airport if you don't mind a drive.
Great location for easy transportation to airport.  Free shuttle service.

review.title: Nice hotel close to beach, downtown and airport
review.reviewText: Nice clean comfortable convenient,affordable, access to freeway and secured parking lot

review.title: Good customer service
review.reviewText:
A good night's sleep.

Only my SPG number was not recognised 41581822950
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable and excellent free shuttle service

review.title: Great staff.
review.reviewText: It was good....staff was great, I liked that the room had a fridge.

review.title: Inexpensive Option Close to Downtown SF
review.reviewText: While the outside of the hotel looks a bit dated, the interior was very nice. The room was clean and comfortable, with the exception being the tub. There was some stain in it that was a bit disgusting. We never logged a complaint, but it should have been cleaned properly or have the tub replaced if the stain couldn't be removed. Being close to the airport, we didn't hear a lot of noise from the planes, which was a plus. Overall, I would stay here again.

Nice place, rooms are big, sofa bed and under sofa was extremely dirty in rm 415. Bedroom window did not shut right so the freeway noise was loud, however the place is nice then the front desk made it right!
friendly and helpful staff, very comfortable room.

review.title: AC not working, front desk horrible.
review.reviewText: Front desk horrible, no concept of kindness, reservation not found and applied higher rate, no smile, no apologies for mistakes made.

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText:
The room was very clean, new and great appearance. The beds were very comfortable. My wife does not remember such a good nights sleep in a hotel for a long time. 
Thank you so much Four Points Sheraton. 
Ps. If all of your hotels are like this you have a winner

review.title: Staff were excellent
review.reviewText: Staff were excellent and enthusiasm, bed clean and comfortable, room spacious, the thing i don't like is bathroom, small and not functional, over all is ok for the person who need to catch early flight.

review.title: Nice and affordable
review.reviewText: Location was not the best. We were about 20-30 min from Golden Gate Park, which is where we were for the most part. But the cleanliness and comfort of the hotel made our overall stay great. Our room was very quiet and clean. Bed was extremely comfortable. There is a low parking charge and we were able to find a space in the garage even after coming back late at night. The rate was probably the best in all of San Francisco so we would stay again if needed to.
review.negativeRemarks: Theres nothing you can do about location...  But it would've been nicer to be closer to main attractions.

review.title: Amazing staff!
review.reviewText: Staff was wonderful!!! Extremely helpful, very nice, and accommodating
review.positiveRemarks: staff, rooms are clean and comfortanble

review.title: Close to the airport
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a great location for my recent trip.  Close to the airport and the main hubs for transportation to both the city and silicon valley.

review.title: Nice hotel friendly staff
review.reviewText: Overall good experience hotel is close to all the places we needed to go.

review.title: Good hotel close to airport
review.reviewText: Booked the hotel for the location since I was flying home early the next morning.  Hotel is off the highway with a gas station right next door.  Room was nice.  Staff was friendly.
review.locationRemarks: Right by airport with the a gas station next door.

review.title: NO WAKEUP CALL, traffic, loud neighbors
review.reviewText: We asked for a quiet room but had loud freeway and airplane noise. The room was hot but the air conditioner was loud. Thin walls with partying neighbors next door (hotel staff finally asked them to be quiet). There was a flashing green light that couldn't be turned off. We asked for a 5:00 a.m. wakeup call for an early flight, and they never called! Went for breakfast in their cafe, and no one came out of the kitchen to take my order or anything for ten minutes, so I left. Would never stay at one of these hotels again.
review.negativeRemarks: Soundproof rooms, cafe service, get rid of flashing green light.
review.locationRemarks: In light industrial area near freeway.

review.reviewText: Room had a musty smell. Poor lighting. Bad food at restaurant. Great staff though.  Very nice.

review.title: Very nice
review.reviewText: Enjoyed this hotel very much. Check in and check out was extremely fast. Hotel ambience was extremely beautiful. Front desk staff was pleasant, extremely great service. Close to airport.
Quiet stay, no airport or freeway traffic noise!! We stayed here while my daughter had surgery at children's  hospital at ucsf misson bay.

review.title: Not enough parking.
review.reviewText:
We got back to the hotel late and could not find a parking spots. We park at the on ramp.
Overall it is okay.

review.title: Last night of our vacation
review.reviewText:
We chose to stay at this particular hotel on the last night of our vacation as it was convenient for car rental return and I prefer to stay at a Sheraton when I can. (I travel for business frequently).

Check-in was fast and easy. The beds were, as always, comfy and cozy. The waiter downstairs took excellent care of us after a long day at Fisherman's Wharf. :o)
review.negativeRemarks: Snack options in the "convenience store" were very limited.
review.locationRemarks: Limited activities due to location. Stayed within the confines of the hotel once we checked in.

review.title: Airport overnighter
review.reviewText: Great for a quick night before airport departure.

review.title: Boken
review.reviewText:
Frig didn't work, A/C didn't work. 
Called it in and no one came to fix them, or offer to change rooms.

review.title: horrible staff
review.reviewText: i booked a loft room through Expedia . When I arrive they tell me they are all sold out of loft rooms . If I wanted a refund or price adjectment I would have to call Expedia then they would be able to assist me . They were not very helpful at all . I would not recommend this hotel

review.title: Much Improved!
review.reviewText:
After reading some negative reviews, I was a bit skeptical.  We booked the hotel on star rating only to capture a good rate.  The hotel exceeded my expectations.  Parking is a drawback.  They charge $12/night.  It's proximity to the airport and tight space is likely the reason.

Staff was very personable.  Room was clean.  Double set of windows really kept the sound level low even though it's right next to the freeway.
review.negativeRemarks: Don't charge for parking....

review.title: BUGS ARE YOU KIDDING ME!!!!!
review.reviewText: The first night  we were there someone pulled a fire alarm around 1:45AM which caused the hotel to be evacuated, kept us out of our room for over 2 hrs.  Then around 8:00AM the construction in the room above us. When we returned to our room that night we found ants on the night stand crawling out of the outlets. When I called the desk. They sent somw one up with a can of bug killer and he proceeds to spray the whole room.  Then chuckled and said I brought air fresher.

review.title: close to freeway
review.reviewText: Easy, friendly and helpful staff, clean rooms, nice amenities.
review.negativeRemarks: stairs to entrance--no ramp at street level
review.locationRemarks: SF

review.title: Nice, near airport and 101 frwy.
review.reviewText: First, every hotel employee I came across was very customer service oriented. Very friendly and accommodating. I booked a queen loft. Room was clean and comfortable. Showed some minor wear and tear, but the room, for the price, was outstanding. Downstairs is a living area and sofabed; bed and bathroom upstairs. Perfect if u travel with another couple or just need/like extra space. Will definitely stay here again.

The hotel overall was good for the price that we reserved it for. The only discrepancy was that the air conditioner was broken and the heater was running instead in 70 degree weather in San Francisco. We moved to another room that the air conditioner functioned and it was a great stay from there.
We stayed 1 night. It was perfect what we needed it for. Close to airport.

review.title: Renovations, Ants in Room
review.reviewText:
I stayed in this hotel in December 2014. I enjoyed that stay, except I was disappointed they charged for parking, $10 per night. Overall -- except for some very loud guests -- I enjoyed my 2 night stay.

My recent stay was quite unpleasant. I arrived at the hotel and the lobby/reception area is in the process of renovation. This information is not listed on the website and does make a difference to guests. In fact, when I was in the elevator, a woman who had just checked, told me she would not have stayed at the hotel if she knew it was undergoing changes. At check in, I commented on how different the lobby area looked and was told about the changes being made to the restaurant and reception area. I went to my room and turned on the lights. Ants were on the desk. I immediately gathered my things, returned to the reception desk and asked for another room. I told the reception clerk about the ants and she assigned me to another room on the second floor, room 202. She told me it would be quiet, etc. Room 202 is across from the gas station and the freeway. There was another loud sound emanating from a structure on the hotel. I have NEVER stayed in a room that noisy, and I have stayed at many hotels. I was too tired to ask for another room and put in earplugs and tried to sleep. I awoke several times during the night because of the noise, which sounded like a generator. 

When I checked out, the reception desk had been moved into another location and workers were in my way.
review.negativeRemarks: If a hotel is in the process of renovation, that info should be on the website. Get effective pest control, reduce noise.
review.locationRemarks: Didn't have a chance to do anything other than try to sleep, which was impossible.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: The hotel lobby was under renovation and a free access room was given to us with the excuse it was the only room available.

review.title: Good airport hotel
review.reviewText: Stayed here with an early flight next morning. Checked in early and got a free upgrade then took BART into the city, conveniently done through airport. Room was comfortable. Good bed, updated furnishings. Bar and restaurant in hotel. Shuttle service convenient and on time.
Not enough parking. A bit old. But overall more than sufficient

review.title: Loved it. Modern, clean. Some traffic noise
review.reviewText: Excellent standard to room. Traffic noise from from road just outside window but it did not bother us. Free bottle of water every day. Good food and drinks to purchase.

review.title: business stay
review.reviewText: positive stay experience, fast to airport and shuttle is convenience.
Out of the three nights that I stayed there, my room only got cleaned once.
review.negativeRemarks: Out of the three nights that I stayed there, my room only got cleaned once.

review.title: Tablet missing!
review.reviewText:
I stayed at the Four Points Sheraton for 3 nights. Some of the hotel staff are friendly and some are very unhappy workers. 

On our third night, both keys stopped working and it was an inconvenience to go to lobby but the staff that helped me did not speak a word. Asked me for my room #, fixed my key and walked away with no smile or anything, as if I inconvenienced her. 

The worst part of my experience is that I lost my tablet. It was in my room, in the suitcase and now it's missing. I filed a claim and spoke with the managers there but they told me I had to go to the police and file a report. 

Don't ever stay here or if you do, don't have any valuables in the room.
review.negativeRemarks: STAFFING.
review.locationRemarks: airport

review.title: Nice hotel. Close to the freeway and everything.
review.reviewText: Hotel staff are amazing. Ask for really early check in because if my father in law's funeral and they were so accommodating and nice. The hotel is very nice and clean. Would stay here again and recommend it to everyone.

review.title: Close to SFO
review.reviewText:
Commuted to downtown SF by Bart for 5 days very convenient.
BART stations smelled of urine  and other unpleasant stuff.

review.title: Very noisy next to highway
review.reviewText: Windows are very thin and highway traffic is persistent throughout the nihgt

review.title: Not a well run hotel
review.reviewText: Poor attention to detail; no follow up by front desk staff
review.negativeRemarks: Stuff didn't work, like the air conditioning system, and the plug in the sink.

review.title: Basic hotel close to airport
review.reviewText:
Room was fine but smelled a little old and bedding and bed sheets seemed old, cotton was balled, some stains and just generally crumpled looking and not appealing for a comfortable nights sleep.


Breakfast was good but nothing special
review.negativeRemarks: Bedding, room freshness,
review.locationRemarks: Very close to the airport.  Locked by roads.  Had a tough time finding somewhere to walk/run but found a trail right before leaving.

review.title: Not Nice at all !
review.reviewText:
Book the hotel through Expedia at $243 per night which is expensive for this type of hotel. Hotel receptionist booked me in room 332 which does not have internet access. I called few time for assistant.... nothing happen. then the operator said that nothing she can do ! I asked to change my room, they said " no room available".
I am a Gold member of SPG. This is not a type of service that I expected.

review.title: Prepare to park in a tight spot
review.reviewText: The parking was an issue & the spots were tight & limited.  Also, the entrance was odd. But room was clean and the bed was comfortable. Staff was kind & helpful.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: This is a nice hotel. Staff was great and my room was clean. I will stay here again when I have to travel to San Francisco again.

review.title: Not able to connect in the room WIFI
review.reviewText: Room was not ready yet when we arrived the hotel. Waited for 45 minutes at the lobby until the staff told us that we will be upgraded to a loft since the room is not available. WIFI in the room is not working. Called the internet support abd they created ticket for the issue. Internet issue was not fixed until we checked out.

review.title: Nice enough for an overnight stay
review.reviewText:
I booked 1 night here as I did not feel like driving to Napa on the same night as we flew in. The bed slept well but the duvet cover had alot of pulled spots on the linen which depicted the care of the linen. It looked like little bugs at first but after a closer look you could just tell the linen was not handled properly.

Outside of the linen the stay was OK.

I also did not like that we had to pay $10 bucks for parking on the hotels own property. San Francisco pings you for everything!
review.negativeRemarks: Linen quality and the maintenance of your linen.
review.locationRemarks: Nothing; it was hard to find food. We ended up at Denny's.

review.title: Appealing from far but far from appealing
review.reviewText:
This hotel looks great from the outside, however, it is very poorly maintained resulting in a very bad experience. Firstly, the elevator did not work. This meant hauling three suitcases up three floors of stairs - No help was offered. Secondly, the bed was broken. The bed was an A shape because the middle was broken and both sides were slanting towards the ground. Any movement made the bed rock like a ship. When I told the front desk lady she responded 'That's great' I asked if she heard what I said to which she said 'Yes'
I'm glad we had an early flight because neither my husband or I slept all night.
review.negativeRemarks: Maintain the hotel to a higher standard so people can at least sleep

review.title: Be prepared to pay for parking.
review.reviewText:
It is a simple place to stay for a quick overnight. This was not my choice of a hotel but since the Hilton Garden cancelled my reservation with expedia at the last minute (in route to the city) this was where they placed me. The hotel was ok since we were only staying 8 hours. I would not stay here more than one night. The front desk staff was good. The hotel itself was a little run down and kinda creepy at midnight. I also hate to pay for parking! It is right next to the 101 which makes it easy to jump on the highway and go, which we did!
I am very grateful to Expedia's amazing customer service to not leave me and my daughter stranded.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff member who checked me into the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: A little dark in the hallways at night.
review.locationRemarks: We crashed here to go spend the day at the beach off hwy 1. Super simple.

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText: The hotel was great for a one night stay. The only thing I had an issue with is that I asked for a wake up call and did not receive one. Which would have been a major issue if I had not set my phone alarm as well.

review.title: Satisfied customer
review.reviewText: I only stayed the one night, but it was satisfactory. About what I expected for the price, maybe a little better. Except for some stains on the carpet the room was well-appointed and clean. My only complaint, albeit minor was that the Wi-fi access I was told was public had a listing of various accesses that I had to sort through, by trial and error, until I found the right one.
review.positiveRemarks: Good value and close to the airport
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing much
review.locationRemarks: It has a gas station next door, which is useful if you have a rental car you have fill up with gas before returning it.

review.title: San Franciso Airport Hotel
review.reviewText: friendly check in staff until you need info or help , then the friendliness dries up quick. Room is clean and comfortable. Problem with the coffee maker...steam shot out and burned my husband's hand.
review.negativeRemarks: staff not helpful..friendly but when asked a question or having a problem the phoney friendliness is GONE. Noisy. Parking fees.
review.locationRemarks: ideal for the airport traveler

review.title: San Francisco
review.reviewText: Noisy a.m. airport traffic. Comfortable bed and room. Problem with the coffee maker...went to reload and the steam spurted out and burned my husband's hand. No COURTESY Parking...though it was easy. No spa.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff is overly too phoney friendly but when a question or problem the friendliness dries up instantly.It wasn't busy but the staff did not try to ini
review.locationRemarks: Location is very convenient for the airport
The Iarport perfect location

review.title: Exllentent Stay, comfy hotel, will stay again...
Really nice hotel close to airport.
review.reviewText:
Staff could have been friendlier and more helpful. Really comfortable room. Restaurant very nice, wait staff were nowhere to be found. I had to go and look for our waiter near the kitchen.

Loved the airport shuttle. Really handy.

review.title: Four Points
review.reviewText: The only bad thing I have to say is the towel were dirty when I got there. I had to swap them out but overall the stay was perfect and I will be coming back soon.

review.title: Heard people above and beside my room to the wee h
review.reviewText: The facility was fine and the bed was comfortable but the walls and floors are paper thin and doors slam at all hours. Convenient, near sfo, free shuttle there but if you need sleep, I think holiday inn or hilton has to be better!

review.positiveRemarks: Excellent food and wine at the restaurant, very nice room, very helpful and polite personnel!

review.title: Good Place to stay in South SF
review.reviewText: Helpful staff at front desk, clean room with good TV. A solid three star level hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Reasonably priced for value received. Close to SF airport and 101 freeway. Good assortment of restaurants within a couple miles of location.

review.title: Return travel stay
review.reviewText: Recommend this hotel.

review.title: Great hotel in close proximity to the airport.
review.reviewText: This was a pretty good hotel and is in a great place if you are trying to stay close to the airport. Even though it's right off the interstate it is not that noisy. I slept very well.

review.title: Comfortable but....
review.reviewText:
Hate the fact that with 2 nights, there is no complimentary breakfast.
Also to pay for parking is totally ridiculous.
Every move it seems like there's a fee.

review.title: Good Airport Hotel
review.reviewText: The Four Points Sheraton is a very well located airport hotel, which provides everything that you would expect. The rooms are clean and in very good condition, the beds and linens are very comfortable, and the common areas generally are good quality. I have stayed here before, and I certainly would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: The convenient location for the airport. The bed and linens, which were superb for a hotel in this price category.
review.locationRemarks: This is not a hotel for tourists visiting San Francisco. It is far from most of the tourist attractions.

review.title: Hotel staff is helpful.
review.reviewText: Overall, it was a good experience of the stay. Staff provided good information and helpful with good courtesy.

review.title: Night in Sam Fran
review.reviewText: The staff was very friendly and the room met all of my expectations. I would stay here again.

review.title: Great bar staff
review.reviewText:
We were staying because of an early flight the next day. We had walked all over SF that day and needed a beer when we finally arrived at the hotel.
The bar staff, a lady from Slovakia, was extremely friendly and helpful. She was the waitress later for our meal and we thoroughly enjoyed it.
She made it a very acceptable short stay.
review.locationRemarks: Near the airport. We didn't go out to find things to do near by. We just left the next morning to get our plane.

review.title: Okay hotel just a few miles from the San Francisco
review.reviewText: Upon arrival, I was granted an upgrade to a Queen Size suite. The room was on the top floor and had a great set up. Unfortunately, the AC was broken and the room was extremely hot. The staff quickly found another room and the rest of the night was uneventful.
review.negativeRemarks: Air Conditioning in rooms
review.locationRemarks: You're in San Fran. Sky is the limit!

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Very convenient if you need a place close to the Airport, absolutely rocking staff.
review.positiveRemarks: The co-operation of the staff, I came early by 45 minutes so I requested a early check in and they helped me with it. Amazing!!

review.title: close to airport
review.reviewText: good if u need a place your head down overnight. location close to airport but not much to do. had to go out to find food, drinks. Houlihans accross the street in holiday in

review.title: Okay Hotel
review.reviewText: Nice staff but for the value my overall expectations were not met
review.positiveRemarks: Nice rooms and in the area I needed to be in
review.negativeRemarks: The towels are not white... appearance did not look clean. For the price of the hotel, I'm expecting exceptionally clean and white bathroom towels.
review.locationRemarks: Airport and SFBI

review.title: Nice hotel. 15 mins from SF downtown
review.reviewText: Good hotel. Not far from city. Clean, easy to park. I dont understand why they charged for parking.
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant inside
review.locationRemarks: No bad, close to the highway.

review.title: Airport hotel
review.reviewText: Convenient location close to the airport offering free shuttle service. The staff were friendly and helpful and had computer and access to a printer. Need to note no wi-fi. The burgers tasted great and the beer was cold.

review.title: Pleasant staff, excellent room service
review.reviewText:
Checkin was very efficient, staff very friendly. Room very comfortable and quiet.

Room service (albeit a bit pricey) promptly delivered and exceptionally delicious.

I would definitely stay here again in the future.

review.title: Perfect plave before an eatly morning flight
review.reviewText: Great access to airport by shuttle. we dropped are rental car then went to the airport to get shuttle to hotel. So no car return at 4 am. only small complaint is shuttle runs every 30 minutes so had to wait as we just missed one.

review.title: good
review.reviewText: Good hotel big rooms beds are compy the hotel staff was good. If u try to check in early they won't let you till it's 3:00.i didn't like that. there is not a lot of parking.

review.title: Nice and comfy hotel. Close to airport.
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel for my flight transition. I required to check in early, the front desk staff was very nice and let me checked in at 12:00PM that was 3 hours earlier than the regular check-in time. The queen bed in my room is very comfy and the bath room is nice and clean.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to airport, airport shuttle, nice and quite room.
review.negativeRemarks: None.

review.title: Great hotel for a good price
review.reviewText: It's clean and meet all our expectations. Very close to the airport

review.title: Better stay on cheap price
review.reviewText: good location. no noise. calm. clean. good amenities. helpful staff.

review.title: Great night's sleep
review.reviewText: This hotel was very clean with good customer service and a free shuttle to and from the airport. The room was spacious and clean and the bathroom was the same. There was even a computer and printer I could use free of charge in the lobby. I have no complaints. I just wish it didnt cost 182 per night. But nwould definitely stay again if I return to san francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast looked very pricey!
review.locationRemarks: Nothing near by except an IHOP and other hotels. Youd have to take the huttle to the airport then transfer to the BART to get into the city.

review.title: Simple hotel
review.reviewText:
This simple hotel was available for staying over night when I needed it. That does say a lot. Checkin and checkout was a breeze. No breakfast included which really doesn't mean much. Room service was fairly decent and not ridiculously priced.

The staff was friendly. The amenities were lacking and room and hallway cleanliness was poor. The bathroom had been cleaned, it seems, but there was a soap pre-opened in the dish and waste from it and something else in the trash bin. Linens are done without a fitted sheet. No usb ports, but plenty of power jacks and an ethernet option. Wireless was sub par in range and throughput... So practically useless. Maybe that varies by room.

Some of the artwork was adequate as was drapery to give the room what life it had.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff... Shuttle to airport 5mins and 35 mins after the hour.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness. The brighntess of halls and rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Airport, less close than you might like, but very useful.

review.title: OK Hotel, Unattractive Location
review.reviewText:
Having recently stayed in a Sheraton Four Points hotel, and having a "5" level experience, I decided to try this hotel on a recent trip to San Francisco given its brand. This hotel is located north of SFO, about 60 feet off Highway 101, wedged between 101 and the Airport Boulevard. Unlike other airport hotels south of SFO, this sits in an industrial area completely surrounded by roads. I give it a thumbs down for location.

That said, the staff were nice, the room was clean, it was not noisy (in spite of its proximity to 101). Ultimately, it was expensive for the experience of staying there, especially with the addition of an overnight parking charge for a car. I will stay elsewhere next time.
review.negativeRemarks: Location is a non-starter for me relative to other options.

review.title: Paid for a king and got two queens
review.reviewText: I went though Expedia.com and book a king sized bed. When I arrived at the hotel for our last nights stay in San Francisco before having to catch a plane back to ga. The staff was okay at check in (not very helpfull just very business acting) if that makes since. Everywhere we had been at in San Francisco people were very nice, even at all the other hotels we stay at. At this hotel as I said I booked though Expedia for a king bed and received two queen beds. I paid extra for the king room. After getting to the room and noticing the mistake I went to tell the woman at the desk( same on that checked me in) and she didn't want to look at my room print out or any other info I had that said I booked a king room. She just said that Expedia was the one that requested two queens and then went back to what she was doing like I no longer existed. And yes I was being nice about it. Also do not buy a coke or candy as in the hotel they rip you off. very high price on drinks. Overall very bad staff at the check in desk.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel staff
review.locationRemarks: Nothing around this hotel to do. But close to he airport

review.title: Nice enough hotel closr to my seminar
review.reviewText: Everything was fine except for the housekeeping all they did was take dirty towels and nothing else I actually ran out of toilet paper!! That was not ok!
review.positiveRemarks: It was close to where I was going
review.negativeRemarks: House keeping for sure they sucked!
review.locationRemarks: Just went for a seminar so it was great

review.title: Nice hotel nest to the airport
review.reviewText: surprised that it wasn't noisey being right by the freeway.

review.title: Nice hotel south of downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel is easy to access off the 101 freeway and close to restaurants. It is a short drive into the city.
review.negativeRemarks: The room booked through Expedia was not the room that I was given. I booked a suite but was given a room with two small queen beds. Staff was no help.
review.locationRemarks: The Houlihans restaurant across the street at the Holiday Inn is very good.

review.title: J14780 safeway
review.reviewText:
Took late flight in from milwaukee.
Got to hotel @ 1:00 AM.
Found it easily. Pleasant and quick check in.
I was on a quick business trip and found this hotel to be very efficent.
review.positiveRemarks: Quiet Good parking Convenient easy to find
review.negativeRemarks: Usb ports in room
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport. Very convenient close to main freeway.

review.title: comfortable stay
review.reviewText: Nice, clean and comfortable rooms. Smaller hotel with limited amentities. Staff in the reservations and bar were very courteous and welcoming.
review.negativeRemarks: with limited space available they're very limited for improvement.
review.locationRemarks: near South San Francisco convention center

review.title: Hotel is nice but too close to the freeway.
review.reviewText: Very clean but old bed made it very uncomfortable to sleep. Room very noisy, to close to the freeway.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean and stuff were very nice.
review.negativeRemarks: Freeway noice reduction. Upgrading windows to reduce noice.
review.locationRemarks: Very accessible to the freeway and down town SF is very close. Access to the airport is very convenient.

review.title: Short stay but a positive experience.
review.reviewText: The stay at this hotel was really short. Basically we arrived at 9:00pm and left at 5:30am the next morning. The beds were comfortable and the room itself was nice and clean. The bathroom looked newly renovated. I can't say that I had any complaints based on the fact that our stay was so short. The main reasons that I booked at this hotel was the price, the fact that there was a frequent shuttle to the airport and the fact that the hotel was close to the airport (we needed to catch an early flight).
review.positiveRemarks: Bed was comfortable - slept well. Bathroom looked as if it is had been newly renovated.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport. Frequent shuttles to the airport which for me was a big plus.

review.title: Nice, close to airport.
review.reviewText: We chose this hotel for its proximity to the airport and reasonable price. We were just staying overnight and leaving early in the morning. It was very clean & comfortable for our needs. The entry steps were a bit difficult to manage for my elderly mother, but they did have a wheelchair lift available if needed.

review.title: Too noisy.
review.reviewText: The hotel is right next to the freeway making it to noisy, you can hear all the cars that are passing by the freeway and when it's a big truck or big cars the wall shakes. The fridge has a bad odor, bathroom needs a total make over, towels are thin and totally worn out the color is not even white anymore. Totally disappointed.

review.title: Pleasant stay: We arrived late at night.
review.reviewText: The late arrival was not an issue as we had called in advance to advise. The room was spacious and clean. The desk people were very attentive and made an effort to help when asked. I would stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathrooms were fine. Very picky but a higher shower head would be nice. But that commet in it self shows that the place is fine to stay.
review.locationRemarks: There is an I Hop within a five minute walk and a decent Chinese Buffet across the street.

review.title: Good airport hotel
review.reviewText: It was a brief visit but it was clean and comfortable. The room had a little bit of an Oder. It was quiet and close to airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Oder,
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport, food not far especially if you have a car

review.title: Needed a nice hotel near the airport.
review.reviewText: The room was very comfortable, great bed and soft pillows, just like home. Only complaint was having to wait in line to get questions answered because there was only one person at the desk.
review.negativeRemarks: Need to be sure the shower gel, shampoo and conditioner are restocked (the container in the tub/shower was low on shower gel.)

review.title: Sheraton Four Points-Disappointing
review.reviewText: This hotel was not up to Sheraton Four Points Standards. The lobby was fine, but the halls were very musty and very dark. The room was obvoiusly remodeled, but it really didn't make much difference. The staff did their best and, in particular, the front desk employees were friendly and helpful, but considering I had to pay extra to park, and the condition of the property, I won't be returning.
review.negativeRemarks: Remodel entire property
review.locationRemarks: Location is close to airport, but that's the only thinng good.

review.title: Disapointing
review.reviewText: For the cost, there should be free parking and SOMETHING to eat before having to get on an airplane that serves no food. Also, we never got our wake-up call.
review.negativeRemarks: parking and a continental breakfast
review.locationRemarks: airport

review.title: Great for business travelers.
review.reviewText: Great hotel for business travelers but not great for families.
review.negativeRemarks: There was no complimentary breakfast.

review.title: Clean hotel, easy access
review.reviewText: Very clean room, nicely decorated. Only negative experience was limited parking. Also, had to pay for parking in the garage each night. Being next to the freeway made it a little loud each night, but that is expected
review.negativeRemarks: Parking fee
review.locationRemarks: Easy access to freeway

review.title: Convenience and restful
review.reviewText: Easy to get to and nice and quiet. Friendly staff and good parking. Beds and pillows were very comfortable and everything was clean and in good condition. Good location as easy to get to downtown San Francisco or to Oakland side.
review.negativeRemarks: Paid parking
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to airport and all areas

review.title: Ok place to stay
review.reviewText: This place was ok if you just need a night or two to stay. I was disappointed in the bathroom because our door would not lock and the shower was pretty poor too. I did like that it was right off the freeway and it had a parking garage.
review.positiveRemarks: That it had a parking garage and was close to the freeway
review.negativeRemarks: Make sure that restroom doors can lock and have a better shower head and water pressure.

review.title: Good except for hotel shuttle
review.reviewText: The room and staff were nice, but the shuttle to/from the airport only runs every 30 minutes, which is not very convenient.

review.title: Noisy
review.reviewText: Extremely noisy. Could hear all the traffic on the freeway.

review.title: Outstanding
review.reviewText: Superb customer service, attention to detail, each time feel special..
review.negativeRemarks: Sanna concierge

review.title: I had a comfortable stay here
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff. Good location. Gym is a bit too small.

review.title: GREAT HOTEL GOOD PRICES!!
review.reviewText: NEWLY REMODELED, GOOD, CLEAN , NICE LITLLE BAR AND DOBLE WINDOWS , SOUNDPROOF.... GOOD BEDS...
review.negativeRemarks: NO LIQUORS NEARBY..
review.locationRemarks: MMM.. DEPENDS ON WY ARE YOU THERE>>

review.title: A good Airport hotel
review.reviewText: 1st room had an issue with Aircon, but they changed room for us very quickly. The rooms are a little noisy as the hotel is on a main road and next to an airport - no real surprises there then! - Airport shuttle was efficient and on time.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco is always worth visiting!

review.title: e.g. "Great hotel for a family"
review.reviewText: It's a great hotel to stay. Close to the airport(10 mins drive) and they provide shuttle bus to the airport. Only 15 mins drive to the downtown to enjoy the trip. Free parking, includes garage parking and outside parking. Secure doors.

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText: Nice staff, near to the airport, very convenient location to access the freeway, most of all near to restaurants
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Near to the freeway, near to restaurants

review.title: Convenient to freeways
review.reviewText: Only problem was the heating system. It vibrated on an off all night for 2 nights leaving me a little sleep deprived. Also if you have 4 wheel luggage for convenience like myself the carpets aren't friendly. I had to drag my luggage on 2 wheels.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was 10 minutes from where I needed to be.
review.negativeRemarks: See above about heating system
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to where I needed to be

review.title: Great for famaily and friends
review.reviewText: The Sheraton Four Point should be on everyone's list of hotel to stay. Rooms are very comfortable and your stay will be pleasant.

review.title: no hot water for morning shower
review.reviewText: The hotel itself is acceptable for a night stay for the transit period during the travel. But, one thing need to improve the quality as there was no hot water in the morning for shower. It needs to wait till 11:30am for having shower. Fortunately, we were travelling by our car. If we were to catch a flight on time we wouldn't have had a shower on that day. The staff are good.
review.negativeRemarks: hot water shower needs to be improved
review.locationRemarks: good

review.title: OK for an airport hotel, I guess.
review.reviewText: Right next to the freeway, road noise all night. Free internet is spotty at best.

review.title: Decent place to crash for a night
review.reviewText:
Pros:
- Very lose to SFO
- Covered parking (came in handy in a pouring rain!)
- Comfortable pillows and OK bed
- Older building but decently updated

Cons:
- Excessive trafic noise
- Shower is made for midgets. Forget about taking a nice shower if you are 5'7" or taller

review.title: Well above expectations, in this market area
review.reviewText: I have never before stayed in a hotel where the staff were so eager to arrange early check-in and late check-out for the guests. This may be a universal policy for the Four Points chain, for all I know, but at an airport hotel with international flights arriving and leaving at odd hours - that alone would guarantee my choice in the future. Only if the property itself were run down or the staff unwilling to function at all would I look elsewhere, and neither is the case here. The common areas of the hotel are good and the rooms are ideal. I couldn't ask for better. And to think, I chose this hotel based on its price to reviews relationship. The staff are flawless, in my experience.

review.title: convenient for travellers
review.reviewText: convenient for airport food was good service good would stay there again

review.title: Decent utilitarian hotel near SFO.
review.reviewText: This is not a luxury experience, but it is conveniently located. Would be better if their SFO shuttle was more frequent than every 30 mins.

review.title: Adequate but hard to access
review.reviewText: We arrived late at night at SFO and the hotel shuttle ran twice an hour. In the event, many other hotel shuttles came by twice before the Sheraton Four Points shuttle came by once. And it was packed. Once we arrived at the hotel, laden with three large and four small bags, we discovered there was no ramp into the hotel lobby. The mini-elevator is marked that it is only for use by the disabled. The desk clerk said they plan to remodel soon and a ramp will be installed but until this happens guests should be warned.

review.title: Don't Like Surprises at at Check-in
review.reviewText: Overall - a disappointing experience because even though we had a confirmed room that specified (2) Queen Beds, our guests were told at check-in that only rooms with (1) bed were avaiable. Although later the hotel came up with a room with (2) beds, it was embarassing as these accommodations were arranged for business travel and (2) beds were neccessary.

review.title: close to airport
review.reviewText: Checked in after 11:00 pm. because of late flight and when entering room the temperature was 55 degrees. the thermostat was broken so we had to move to another room. The service tech. was very pleasant though!

review.title: Nice rooms, price not what was quoted on Expedia
review.reviewText: HAD A $50.00 CHARGE TO MY CREDIT CARD FOR PARKING WHICH MADE ME VERY UNHAPPY. Booked hotel through Expedia because of the location and rate but was surprised to have an extra $50 charge. Small hotel and parking limited but ok. Room was very nice and neat. Very clean. Would not consider staying there again since the rate through Expedia was not the actual cost of the stay. Very, very unhappy about that!
review.negativeRemarks: Charge for parking
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport and right off freeway

review.title: Pleasant Stay
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean and staff was friendly. Hotel was quiet for being so close to the airport and freeway.
review.positiveRemarks: access to the freeway on and off.
review.negativeRemarks: having to paying for parking.

review.title: Four Points Motel but Five Points for Comfort
review.reviewText:
Flying into the US from Australia to visit our son and new daughter in law and stayed the night in San Francisco. We were picked up at the airport by the shuttle bus and taken to the motel. The driver was very helpful and pleasant. Staff were very friendly. Room was comfortable but the pillows and the bed were more than comfortable. What a great nights sleep we got!
Thank you Four Points.

review.title: nice hotel - rubbish wifi
review.reviewText: free wifi but it doesn't work - very slow. It wasn't my computer which worked fine everywhere else. breakfast was stale
review.negativeRemarks: wifi and food

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: nice hotel. Amenities are pretty comfortable. Shuttle service is good as it makes transportation very convenient.

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: Friendly well maintained hotel

review.title: Never going back...
review.reviewText:
We will NOT be back. There was mold in the shower and an empty bottle of vodka by the window. Really wanted to find another Starwood property close by, but the Westin was sold out. Honestly, my wife and I pulled all the blankets off and turned the heater up. Just wasn't comfortable at all.

I also encountered a frequent guest of the hotel in a heated discussion with the front desk about his room and the parking situation.

Avoid unless you are desperate!

review.title: dirt on bed cover
review.reviewText:
When I checked in, there was a dirt on top of the bed cover that I noticed that I have to flick to remove it. There were 2 dried stains (ketchup?) on that same bed cover. The underneath cover has a small hole that I could poke in.
The wallpaper in the bathroom is peeling off (you literally can see a whole part of the wallpaper sticking out prominently). There were 2 splattered dried stain on the wall beside the garbage bin that was never wiped off. NO stairs to get to the reception area, so if you are elderly or have back pain, you still have to carry your suitcases up the few steps (or have somebody carry them for you), as there is no ramp for this purpose. Overall, not well maintained Sheraton hotel. This was my first to stay in Sheraton, and I have been many times to Marriott hotels (different locations) and I guess I would prefer next time to stay at Mariott.
Location is good in terms of being near the airport, and the shuttle is 2x every hour.
Sorry folks.

review.title: Not bad convenient
review.reviewText:
no free parking caught by surprise
breakfast not included is undesirable

review.title: Do NOT stay at this hotel. Its AWFUL
review.reviewText:
The hotel is on an EXTREMELY noisy street and even though I specifically asked for a quiet room I am right next to a bus stop so I hear EVERY bus announcement as they pass by.

The rooms are DIRTY and their free internet access SUCKS.

Each time I complained about the internet not working they suggested I reboot my computer. They have NO IDEA.

The pillows are hard and old and the TVs look like they came from the 70's.

Not worth the money.

Overall VERY unhappy with this hotel.

review.title: Lots of noise from above
review.reviewText: The room was okay but overpriced for the quality. The noise conducted through the ceiling was terrible. The party above us paced and bounced on the floor until 1:00 AM. We complained around 10:00 PM to the front desk with no effect. I've stayed in a lot of hotels but this one has the worst sound conduction.

review.title: family
review.reviewText: Not a problem checking in, hotel staff very friendly and professional.

review.title: Not Impressed at all this time
review.reviewText: First night was good. Came back to room on second night, no one had come in to clean up or make the beds. Plus for the first time ever staying at this hotel we had to pay for parking. We have stayed here many times before never had a problem or had to pay for parking.

review.title: close to airport
review.reviewText:
The Hotel was ok, needs some updating for sure but the price was right and close to airport one thing that for sure needs to be done is better food, everything was cold and tasted bland like a buffet style, not one thing was hot both times i stayed and was like it sat out all day long. Very dissapointed in the food for sure.
But good location to airport and price is good.

review.title: Good airport location
review.reviewText: Surprisingly quiet. Good parking, although with a fee. Could use some maintenance--shower curtain should have been replaced. Easy access to freeways to go south or north.

review.title: Trash pit.
review.reviewText:
I wouldn't stay here unless heat, honesty and cleanliness is important to you. You're better off at a motel 6.

I had eyeglasses turn up missing, there was no heat in my room and the over place was dirty and dingy.

I paid for the suite and was given a standard room.

review.title: Just ok
review.reviewText: This hotel was very functional...close to the highways so that was good. Just fine for an overnight-er...

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: The hotel is expensive and run down, not what I expect from a Sheraton

review.title: Great economy choice for San Francisco vacationers
review.reviewText: We didn't want to pay the higher rates in downtown San Francisco, so were very fortunate to locate this Sheraton-managed property near the airport. It was super clean, very friendly, and our king single room was ultra-spacious and well-appointed. The drive into the city was only 20 or 30 minutes depending on traffic and that was a great trade-off for the $100 or more we were saving each night over a downtown hotel. However, if you're traveling without a car, it's probably not such a great choice.

review.title: Did not honor my confirmed reservation - PRE PAID
review.reviewText: For a Starwood Hotel Sheraton branded Four Points, the worst one in the world I have gone to.

review.title: Friendly but
review.reviewText: Check in and check out very friendly. Mix up and given a room already used & not cleaned. New room was +/-. Hairs on toilet & shower before we used them.

review.title: 5 star feel for an affordable rate
review.reviewText: Very beautiful rooms that were very roomy and comfortable. .

review.title: Passing through SFO
review.reviewText: Good location fro a quick hotel stay, a very long wait at airport for the shuttle

review.title: The Bee Hive
review.reviewText: Trust me I am a 100,000 mile a year traveller and this by far is the most noisiest hotel I have ever experienced in all my travels. The hotel is a mere 50 feet from the freeway and if by chance you get a room that is freeway facing or rear facing room heaven help you. The instant I opened the door the buzz was so loud that I closed the door and went back downstairs to request another room. The front desk was helpful and gave me a front facing room which was better but you could still hear the street traffic all night. The hotel is clean, comfortable and the Wi-Fi was good. Personaly I would not recommend that you stay here unless you intend to join a bee hive. Stay accross the street at a Holiday Inn.

review.title: Nice hotel near the airport
review.reviewText:
Nice comfortable rooms. We stayed in a room with two floors -- with a living room area (with a small refrigerator) on the first floor and the bed on the second floor. The room had 1 and 1/2 baths. Free wireless internet access was available in our room. Parking was free (but a bit tight - we almost didn't find a space one night). Hotel staff were friendly and polite.

The key cards to get in to the room did fail to work every day or two -- so we made several trips to the front desk to have our cards fixed -- a bit inconvenient. Food at the hotel is overpriced, but there are a number of local restaurants nearby.

review.title: Four Points SF
review.reviewText:
Check-in was as a breeze. Polite, friendly staff. The room was clean and had all the amenities I had been promised. Very well located for quick access to the airport. The rate was very good for the quality and location of the hotel.

I was, however, a little disappointed to find at checkout that there was no complimentary hotel continental breakfast. The receptionist was a bit frosty when, after inquiring about the breakfast, I asked him to explain what an "open restaurant" was. After realizing that he merely meant that the hotel restaurant was open for the day, he scoffed when I asked if it was complimentary. It was sorely missed, as I had my 3 children traveling with me.

review.title: I'm not go back
review.reviewText: I called to hotel to advice that I will be able to check-in later at night and when I arrive at hotel, there no space at parking lot, I have to put my car on another hotel, in front of Four Points. When open the door of the rom, for my surprise the room was nlot clean. I'm going downstair to complain and gave to me another room, with ONE king bed and the sofa bed, and I have already booked a room with 2 queen bed. It was a not good night.

review.title: Clean, tidy and comfotable
review.reviewText: This Hotel was very clean, tidy and had ver comfortable beds. A little airport noise but overall a great place to stay close to the airport

review.title: Nice for a hotel close to the airport
review.reviewText: Nice enough hotel. The service for breakfast was not so great. Overall it was fine.

review.title: Best choice for an early flight from SFO:
review.reviewText: Easy access, clean and confortable room. Their restaurant is a good choice if you want to avoid a lot of driving in order to find a place to eat.

review.title: 4 Points Sheraton, SF
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel was great. Right at an exit for the 101 so getting into the city was no trouble at all. Getting back to the Airport only took less than 10 minutes. The room and service was great. The only issue during the 10 day stay was no hot water one morning. However, after informing the front desk it was fixed by that afternoon.

review.title: A pleasant surprise, to be honest
review.reviewText: Booked a standard room with a king-sized bed for two nights, and would definitely reserve rooms here again. I was thoroughly impressed by the cleanliness and simplicity of the hotel room we stayed in. The bed was comfortable, the room was spacious, and looked as if it had been recently remodeled/renovated, which is extremely important to me. While this property may not be in the actual city of San Francisco, if you have a car, the city is but a short drive away. My only (somewhat minor) gripe was that our window faced the freeway, and there was a bit too much noise coming through the window even though it was closed. We had to fiddle with it a little to minimize the noise. I would recommend requesting a room on the opposite side for maximum comfort. All in all, a great hotel. Maybe not your 5-star hotel, but certainly a step up from some of the hotels in the surrounding SFO Airport / South San Francisco area.

review.title: Good Deal
review.reviewText:
Well worth the Expedia rate. Small hotel, yet comfortable.
Loved the free parking, morning newspaper and coffee. Travel with a Guide Dog for my wife and she fared well as grass was plentiful on the street but no where to window shop. TV a little confusing but finally figured it out. I would go back again for a short stay but I am afraid my wife would not.

review.title: Close to SFO and comfoortable
review.reviewText: This hotel is a short (5 min) taxi-ride or rental car trip from San Francisco Airport. There is also a shuttle-bus service. It is clean and comfortable and adequate free parking is provided. There is a decent caf/restaurant. It is well suited to travelers who need an overnight stop upon late arrival or before an early departure. I use this hotel regularly when travelng to the Bay Area. No surprises- a good American hotel.

review.title: Good value.
review.reviewText: Good value, so close to the City. Freeway noise w/ windows open, but the double windows blocked most of the noise when closed. Bed too hard.

review.title: Extremely convenient for airport and great price
review.reviewText: The hotel had free parking and was very close to the airport; price was very reasonable and perfect if you are getting an early flight!

review.title: good but noisy
review.reviewText: fine

review.title: Perfect hotel for business travel
review.reviewText: This hotel was just what I needed and wanted for my business trip. I would definetely would choose it again for my net trip to San Francisco.

review.title: Good for Business stay
review.reviewText: Great for business stays- right on hwy 101 so expect traffic.

review.title: Good, cheap hotel near the airport
review.reviewText:
The staff was very friendly, the hotel was right near the airport (and they had a shuttle although I had a car and didn't use it) and the bed was very comfortable. It wasn't too noisy in the room either even though the area is very noisy.

My complaints were that the t.v. did not work, the curtains were stained and disgusting looking and one of the outlets would not hold any cords (they kept slipping out).

Otherwise, for a 3 star hotel near the airport, it was perfect and I would actually stay there again.

review.title: Beautiful SF hotel
review.reviewText: the hotel was clean and beautiful, it exceeded my expectations. Minutes for downtown SF, Golden Gate Bridge, Chinatown, etc. Thank you, Expedia.

review.title: Perfect stay
review.reviewText: It was perfect - parking was free, it was right on the 101 freeway so very convenient. Clean, quiet rooms. Friendly staff. If you need a place to stay while working/visiting in the area, especially the peninsula cities, it is perfect. If you don't have a car and are expecting a "San Francicso Hotel" experience, this is not the place to stay.

review.title: Very close to SFO
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, very close to SFO. Very easy to return a rental car from

review.title: very convient !!!
review.reviewText: We took a chance on this hotel and it worked out perfectly...We had red-eye flights into and out of SF and this hotel has a great shuttle system, plus excellant, professional staff...highly recomend this hotel, great food right downstairs, big pluss.....also, we had to go into the city for dr. appointment, got a cab back to the hotel for about $30, we enjoyed the cabbie, "Anthony", sooooo much, we gave him $40 and he was happy....

review.title: it was good experience
review.reviewText:
I went during Thanksgiving holiday. The rooms are clean and comfortable. They were the right size for the 4 days we were there. The room had a king size bed, couch (which looked a little dirty), table, and tv. It was very basic.
The only cons I have about the hotel is that it has very slow internet connection that we just gave up on it (it took 5 mins to load yahoo home page). The elevators are slow but luckily its only a 4 story building so we just took the stairs. It has a very difficult exit for the 101 S but the north exit was very close. So make sure to get the directions if you don't know your way around the SFO airport area.

review.title: Nice Room
review.reviewText: Stayed one night midweek on a business trip, very nice hotel. Every room had FREE WiFi which in this era of hotels nickel and diming you for every service was very refreshing. I was a little worried about noise since hotel is between the freeway and a major road but the room was very quite and comfortable. I would reccomend!!

review.title: Should be renamed a motel
review.reviewText: The name 'sheraton' is highly misleading. The rooms are small, the staff are unhelpful (and make no attempt to help you with your bags), and the bar closes early and doesn't serve food late. We arrived around ten after a long flight and were unable to get food or a drink (whether at the bar or via room service), and resorted to walking to the travelodge nearby to get both at a reasonable price. Furthermore, the bus which takes you from SFO to the hotel arrives very infrequently, whereas all the other hotels around the airport seem to arrive three times as often. If you are considering staying here, I urge you to pay a little more (not much more at all) and stay at a Hyatt or a Hilton.

review.title: Four Points
review.reviewText: Filipino Reservations clerk during the shift between 1am to 2am was very helpful. Room is clean.

review.title: Very comfortable hotel near airport
review.reviewText: I wouldn't obviously choose this as a hotel to spend my vacations. It's right by the highway and the location is perfect only if you need to catch a flight early the following morning(like I did) or if you land late. This said, it served perfectly its purspose. The bed was very comfortable, the in-room breakfast excellent and the shuttle very convenient to the aiport.

review.title: Convenient for airport
review.reviewText: A comfortable three star hotel that is really convenient for the airport. My wife and I had loads of luggage and were pleased that a free shuttle was available to the hotel. We ate dinner at the hotel and the food was exceptional. We would probably not use this hotel for a long stay in San Francisco but is perfectly fine for a short stay. Good value and would have no hesitation using again.

review.title: will be back
review.reviewText: first thing we noticed was how good it smelled, even in the elevator - now that's attention to details! loved the free water, friendly, profession service; would have like'd a sunday morning paper, pillows were a little flat - not really anything to really complain about. Also loved the free parking. will definately be back, hope they have park,sleep, fly service for our hawaii trip next year!

review.title: Quite OK deal
review.reviewText: Hotel is quite far from the City centre, but very near to the airport. You are at the highway so expect constant noise!

review.title: staff was wonderful
