review.reviewText: i requested a room away from the highway but this request was not met. it probably would have made a difference because the traffic noise was too much for me even w/the a/c on. the bathroom had more mold than i like but was "cleaned" everyday. the rugs could have used a heavy cleaning or even replacement. the staff was very helpful and polite. when i needed something, they delivered. i guess for me, that balanced out the aforementioned problems. i could have asked for another room i'm sure but i was too exhausted to do so.

review.title: Good for the price!
review.reviewText: This hotel is your basic airport hotel. But compared to many of the others around the SF airport, I recommend this one. It was clean and comfortable, and the price was great. I had a few problems: 1. wireless internet would not work in my room. To resolve this, the front desk immediately brought me a LAN cable. 2.The food was extremely over priced and not very good Probably the biggest downside to the hotel. Find somewhere else to eat (IHOP down the road) 3.Card wouldn't work when we arrived. They fixed it immediately. Good Points: 1. Any problems were resolved quickly and kindly. 2. Good room price 3. Good air conditioning 4. Free airport shuttle 5. Personal taxi driver who takes you anywhere at a decent rate 6. Helpful and friendly front desk workers 7. They let me check in at 10:30 AM compared to 3:00 PM. Overall, good for business purposes. But VERY far from downtown.

review.title: Very customer friendly and convenient.
review.reviewText: We would definitely stay there again. The free shuttle to the airport and the restaurant made our trip very stress free.

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText: My family and I enjoyed the Four Points by Shearton in South San Francisco. It was easy to access and the rooms were nice. They don't do a contanetial breakfast but they do have a resturant in the lobby.

review.title: not bad!
review.reviewText: The beds were very comfortable and the room was very clean. Parking was free. Only negative would be how close the hotel is too the highway if noise bothers you when you sleep. Also the airconditioner in our room rattled a bit which was annoying but over all we were satisfied :)

review.title: its was a okay stay
review.reviewText: The room was okay where me and my husband stay in. The room was clean enough for me and my husband to feel comfortable sleeping and to relax the time that we were in, but the internet was a little slow for us but everything else was good....As for our friends that had when with us they didn't like the room that they got but for the price it okay..

review.title: great place
review.reviewText: internet didn't work right and hotel was far and expensive cab ride from fun part of San Francisco.

review.title: Nice hotel by Airport
review.reviewText: Nice hotel for exploring SF. You can take the free shuttle to the airport to take the BART (subway) into the city. Free parking and free internet was a plus. Noise was a factor, but it is always noisey in San Francisco, no matter where you stay. I would say it's a good value. Also has notebook size safe in the room. The staff was very pleasant and efficient

review.title: Room was nice sized
review.reviewText: The last few nights of our SF stay we wanted to be near the airport with shuttle service and found Four Points to be surprisingly wonderful. The room was nice sized for a family of four with coffee & refrig - the bathroom large, clean, and well lit. Plenty of towels were provided. We appreciated the food service within also for breakfast.

review.title: great price performer
review.reviewText: Great value for money. Quiet hotel near airport.

review.title: An average hotel
review.reviewText: It's very neutral and just average. Nothing fascinating. Parking is free.

review.title: WOULD NEVER RETURN
review.reviewText: I Would never return to this hotel the water was shut down for half my stay and once the water was turned back on the water was filthy brown. I was not able to shower at all during my stay. When I had to use the restroom i had to go to a nearby restaurant.

review.title: Sheraton 4 points
review.reviewText: Sheraton should be ashamed to have their name on this hotel. The hotel was downright seedy. Although I had called ahead to make sure they had a restaurnat, which I was assured they did, it was nothing more than a glorified fast food bar. If you wanted anything that wasn't fried or pizza, you were out of luck. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. And it was not a bargain either.

review.title: Sufficent for its purpose
review.reviewText: The hotel caters to the people who want to fly out the next day. It was perfectly adequate for those needs.

review.title: Stay away from this one
review.reviewText: Stayed a total of 3 days in this hotel 1. The only room they had available was one with a Queen Bed, despite taking a reservation for one with a King Bed. 2. At around 9am the following day we had water dripping from the ceiling in several places. (Let know me know if you would like to see the pictures :) ) 3. After contacting the front desk, was given a room where clearly the guest before had smoked, and the room had not been aired/fumigated etc. 4.Checked into a third room which seemed to be okay. 5. Coming back to the room at about 10pm found out the room had not been cleaned. (The used bath towels were removed however; go figure) 6. After complaining, the room was cleaned by the housekeeping manager herself, which was nice of them, I must admit. 7. Next day found out the fridge was broke. Tem control knob had gone missing at it simply froze anything put inside. (Needed to store milk for our 2 year old). 8. Had a grand total of 7 grainy local channels. Were told that it was comcast's fault. Oh and their elevators are the slowest known to civilized world. Save your money. Any "roach motel" would be a luxury compared to this one.

review.title: A Horrible Experience
review.reviewText: This was a horrible experience. The lobby and corridors reeked with a dreadful smell, which I finally recognized as insecticide. It was impossible to even consider eating in the restaurant because of the odor. We couldn't wait to leave -- in fact, we cleared out earlier in the morning than we had planned.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Not bad. Average... the Internet Connection was good.

review.title: One of the worst stays ever....
review.reviewText: Want to stay awake all hours of the night and party with your neighbors? Then, pick this hotel. If not, choose the Holiday Inn across the street. We wheeled our bags from the Sheraton to the Holiday Inn at 10 pm with disgust on our faces from the Sheraton's incompetence.

review.title: the hotel was conveniently located. Easy access to the Bart station.
review.reviewText: The AC/Heating system was noisy. The carpet was old. The vent in the bathroom was not working.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Selected the hotel due to last minute discount, but wouldn't have otherwise. It's too close to highways, small fitness center, lousy TV picture, hotel food quality poor and pricey, no complimentary breakfast, and no close-by outside places to eat. Only advantage is close to the airport.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: We stay at this hotel when ever we are flying out of San Francisco.

review.title: I need a walk, but where....?
review.reviewText: Overall the hotel was very clean & comfortable & the staff was very friendly, but I was disappointed that there was not much available to those who enjoy outdoor recreation. The hotel is surrounded by a freeway on one side & a busy street on the other & I couldn't find any directions on where to go for a brisk morning walk/run...I didn't want to risk getting run over while crossing the street. I know there is a walking path near some of the other hotels nearby & was hoping to find a map or directions to get me there...nada!

review.title: Pretty decent
review.reviewText: Nice, comfortable. It would be nice to have a restaurant. Food at teh bar is just plain - average

review.title: Stayed Twice and Enjoyed this hotel
review.reviewText: Stayed at this hotel on March 27th and also April 3 2009. Got a great rate on Expedia (lower than the hotel's website rate). The staff was exceptional - I left my jacket in the lobby of the hotel on my way back to the airport, and when I called them, they put it on the next shuttle and had it delivered to me. If I had to find fault with something, I would say that neither room had a "Do Not Disturb" sign in it; the 2nd stay on April 3rd, there was no complimentary bottle of water. Neither of these things were that big of a deal. I would definitely stay here again, and recommend it to anyone.BTW - There are were choices for food within walking distance - IHOP, Houlihan's and Lyon's. No fast food within walking distance. Overall, I loved this place, and I'm extremely picky!

review.title: Good but poor fitness center
review.reviewText: nice staff, good clean rooms, very very poor workout room, gym was more like the one u see in motel 6

review.title: Great convenience & good accomodations
review.reviewText: I had a great stay here recently for business as well as to show my in-laws around San Francisco. Check-in and check-out were painless. Any issues I had during my stay were addressed promptly and courteously. I had a problem with the a/c and heater malfunctioning the first night. I was given a portable heater by the clerk; the next day my unit was fixed while I was out on business. I definitely recommend this hotel to anyone due to its fair pricing and convenience. It's very close to the airport and city. At the same time, it's great access to South SF.

review.title: Would go back
review.reviewText: Despite the hotel being near the airport, dual pane windows kept jet noise at a minimum. I-Hop is with-in walking distance and is open 24hrs. Conference Center is across the street. Check-in was efficient..

review.title: great convenience
review.reviewText: Very comfortable beds, great staff, especially enjoyed the hotel bar and restaurant. It was very convenient not to head out every night for dinner or cocktails.

review.title: Last minute booking
review.reviewText: Great last minute booking for the airport.

review.title: Ok for a stop over
review.reviewText: There is nothing around locally if you have no car when staying at this hotel. I would recommend it for those on a layover for one night. It has all the mod cons and the beds are very comfy. They serve food at certain times during the day, though a tad overpriced. There is an IHOP within a short walking distance which is perfect for cheap breakfast and over the road at the Holiday Inn there is a sports bar and restaurant which does good food at a reasonable price.

review.title: Might as well stay at motel 88
review.reviewText: I've stayed in hotels all around the world, ranging from five-star to no stars. Rome, Istanbul, Shenzhen, Beijing, Macau, most of China and Hongkong actually, Singapore, Australia, Indonesia, Cambodia, Thailand, London, Vegas, Los Angeles, Santa Monica etc etc but none have infuriated me like the four points by sheraton. Like my travelling companions said, "four points out of 10". The service was terrible, they wouldn't let us check in till 3pm, they didnt call to remind us to leave at 11am, so at 11.20am i had a lady dressed in pedestrian clothes at my door looking at me like i had committed a heinous crime, saying "What time are you guys checking out??" and I replied in puzzlement, "who (the hell) are you??" I called the front desk and said, "sorry for late check out, i thought it would be at 2 (since they asked us to check in at 3 remember?), and the guy at front desk decided to give me a lecture on Hotel Management 101 "No hotel in the world checks out at 2pm" I noticed they were nicer to people who were older, so you people under 35, do NOT stay there, unless it's a last resort. You will be treated like crap.

review.title: Not Impressed at All
review.reviewText: Hotel Bar only open till 10. Maid did not clean our room. Woken up by housekeeping early morning on day of departure.Not bad but would not stay there again.

review.title: Good for the $$
review.reviewText: Hotel needs some up dating but the service was excellent. The rooms had musty odor to them. We originally were put in a room that smelled very smokey. They promptly switched us to one that was not as bad with the smoke but was must (old/wet). My son lost his toy in the first room but with in a few hours the cleaning folks found it and delivered it to our new room even though the other room had already been occuppied. Obviously the new occupants did not mind the smoke as much as we did. I think for the money this was a decent place in S.F. to stay. We are very picky when it comes to hotels

review.title: Close to SFO, nice place to stay.
review.reviewText: Good locations with god confort.

review.title: When visiting San Francisco- I'd stay there again.
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice and the personnelle extremely friendly. There was not much to do around the area but a great place to sleep.

review.title: The other Sheraton at SFO
review.reviewText: I thought I was staying at the Sheraton SFO airport, so when the cab dropped me off and I tried to check in, I was turned away to the Four Points Sheraton back up the road and a $17 cab ride later. The hotel is located just off the freeway (although noise wasnt' a big problem) - there is not much around the hotel. Cannot walk to restaurants or stores nearby. I was welcomed by a strange lobby, that doesn't have a ramp for luggage (carrying two heavy suitcases up a flight of stairs doesn't seem like a big deal, but these days it is an inconvenience. I was greeted by a friendly employee at checkin, and took the very slow elavator to my room. I had a very difficult time logging into the internet, but the front desk was kind enough to send up an ethernet cable, which logged me in to their FREE internet easily. I needed a jacket dry cleaned which they completed as committed in 1 day, and they were friendly at check out. The general condition of the hotel was ok. Not great, not horrible. The rate on expedia was the reason I chose this hotel - but I wouldn't come back just for the accomodations.

review.title: Hotel was fine
review.reviewText: Nice Business Hotel. Airport shuttle worked perfectly

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Was expecting much more from a Sheraton Hotel at that price. Not very clean, strange odor in the hallways and room, stained towels. More like a cheap best western.

review.title: would certainly return to this hotel
review.reviewText: We have stayed at several hotel in the San Francisco area and this is definately one of the better choices, especially for the rate.

review.title: A great place to stay after a Ballgame
review.reviewText: The room was great and very comfortable!

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Clean and comfortable.

review.title: Great Place to Stay
review.reviewText: Sheraton Four Points was a wonderful experience. The service was outstanding. I arrived early on the 4th of July, around 11 am. I was told at first that the check in wasn't until 3pm. I only said "Wow! I guess I can wait." And the young lady said for me to hold on. She checked with house Keeping and I was able to check in right away! That's grade A-1 to me. The food was great and housekeeping never missed a day of cleaning up the room. I would stay here again and again.

review.title: We'll be back!
review.reviewText: When we first got in our room it smelled like smoke we called down to the front desk they immediately brought another key to another room which worked out for us. At first I thought by the airport it would be loud. I never heard one airplane or even traffic noise. We'll be back. This is a safe San Francisco hotel if you do not want to be in the middle of all the traffic and people.

review.title: Pricey but nice
review.reviewText: Breakfast way too expensive but considering it's SF, guess it was was in line....

review.title: its all goooooddddddd
review.reviewText: thumbs up on this one .....

review.title: Great night sleep
review.reviewText: The comfort of the hotel bed was great. They could clean up the windows and hotel a little. I traveled for business so I appreciated the large desk and internet, however the internet was not high speed. I did not like that they put me in a room facing the expressway, traffic was loud. Nice to have a coffee pot in the room, refrigerator and free bottle of water.

review.title: Dont bother booking this noisy joint.
review.reviewText: Too noisy!!!!

review.title: A great hotel not too far from the attractions.
review.reviewText: Great front desk service and clean rooms!

review.title: Comfortable and convenient
review.reviewText: As usual their rooms/beds are comfortable, have all the things I like without outlandish cost. The hotel is also convenient for coming and going from SFO.

review.title: Good for a weekend for a family
review.reviewText: Everything was so great. Accepetabel distance to downtown S.F.

review.title: Okay for a place to lay your tired head
review.reviewText: The beds were comfortable but not the cleanest place I have stayed in. There was a booger stuck to the bottom of the bathroom door and the carpet in the room left little to be desired. I felt as if I should be wearing spa sandals to walk around in there as if I were staying at a frat house. The housekeepers couldn't wait to clean the room in the morning and would enter at 8 am. It wasn't a bad place but they should really clean the place up a lot!

review.title: Great last minute deal
review.reviewText: Hotel was conveniently located near freeway/airport/warehouse store (for cheaper gas). Parking lot was full. Free shuttle to/from airport is plus. Bed was great and glad I chose this place for the 2 nights I was in town.

review.title: Nice Commuter Hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel was convenient to SFO/Highways 101/380. A little noisy on the side of the hotel facing the freeway (less than 100 yards away). Reasonable room rate and easy availability.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: The staff was ill informed and gave me bad directions. They didn't know if the hotel was nort or south of the airport. Pretty basic stuff. They charged me for parking when the Expedia ad said it was free. Also the airport shuttle was lame. I waited an hour at the airport for the shutttle that comes every 25 minutes. Still can't figure that one out.

review.title: Right next to freeway exit
review.reviewText: The staff were friendly and helpful. The downside was that it was next to freeway and sometimes you can hear the traffic.

review.title: Would Go Back
review.reviewText: For a short stay, this hotel was very close to the airport and more than adequate. Staff was friendly and helpful. On site restaurant was surprisingly good.

review.title: Good for quick Biz trip one-night stay
review.reviewText: Very close to SFO airport and great front desk service & support. Looked like the rooms have been renovated couple years ago -- in above average condition.

review.title: Near SFO
review.reviewText: Room was very comfortable. Bed was great. Nothing special about the common areas or surroundings of the hotel. Underground parking was good.

review.title: Would Reserve Again
review.reviewText: Rooms have dual paine windows to drown out freeway traffic noise. Restaurant and bar on site but no lunch served. Small business center on 2nd floor with room card needed for access. Small safe in room and there is room/dining service. Would stay again...

review.title: Dollar-saver but not 3-stars or worthy of the Sheraton Brand
review.reviewText: Advantages: proximity to SF airport, and main roads. Well located to Milbrae for Dinner, Daly City for shopping, excursion to Half Moon Bay. Ample free parking space (covered). Frequent shuttle to SF airport (although we didn't use it). Self-service laundry. Relatively inexpensive at the time (early Feb,'08). Disadvantages: Does not deserve the 3 star rating, and a misrepresentation of the Sheraton brand! Run-down Condition! Carpets Urgently need replacing, beds creak, beds & pillows too soft, doors need extra shove to lock, elevator is old and dirty. No bathroom scales in the entire hotel(guests need to check the weight of their suitcases to avoid hefty airline surcharges). Permanently waterlogged basement carpark. Front desk not very knowledgeable about local shops and gas stations.

review.title: We enjoyed our stay.
review.reviewText: The friendly and professional staff made our stay exceptionally pleasurable. Everyone from the front desk to and the servers were pleasant and helpful. The food was delicious and served with class. My mother and I throughly enjoyed our stay.

review.title: Great Place to stay
review.reviewText: The rooms are very nice and large, The beds were comfortable and had nice thick comforters. Even though it is by the airport we couldn't hear anything. they also give you nice ammenitites. Shampoo, Conditioner, mouthwash, etc. I would definately recommend staying here again. The downstairs restaurant is kind of expensive but, there is a good restaurant right around the corner.

review.title: Very good value and convenience
review.reviewText: We found this hotel to be very comfortable and reasonably priced. It is close to the airport and highway 101, providing easy access to San Francisco.

review.title: near airport
review.reviewText: Adequate but not exceptional in everything.

review.title: Wrong room description
review.reviewText: I chose this hotel out of many around the San Francisco International Aiport because it was one of the few to offer a room with two queen beds. BUT low and behold, their rooms were only equipped with full size beds. I even called the hotel the night before to make sure I would get a room with two Queen beds, and was told that this request would be fulfilled with an eighty percent chance. Too bad that such a room does not even exist in this hotel.

review.title: met my needs
review.reviewText: Friendly hotel staff, made you feel at home

review.title: Disappointed with the check in
review.reviewText: We were disappointed with a problem we had shortly after our check in. We were in our room (approx.)20 min. after our check in when our door was opened up by another guest. It seems that our room was given out to another guest after we had checked in. The other guest quickly left and went downstairs to complain. About 20 minutes later

review.title: Stay Was Okay
review.reviewText: Hotel was fine but parking was awful. $41/nite to park in a lot down the street and hope there were spaces

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: The hotel was a great place after driving in from the San Bernardino area. The front desk staff was very helpful with maps and driving instructions. We would not hesitate to go back again.

review.title: Hotel is okay - bar is atrocious
review.reviewText: Desk staff were prompt and efficient. Room was clean and well maintained. However, do not try to get a drink in the hotel bar. Service (at the bar or at a table) and quality of drinks are atrocious.

review.title: Decent rooms but not so great service
review.reviewText: Very confortable hotel, but lack customer service. Receptionist was not welcoming in any sense, but I did get my room so it was sufficient.

review.title: easy access to airport, free internet, friendly shuttle service
review.reviewText: friendly, professional front desk staff. friendly staff at restaurant, very accommodating to late night & early morning schedules.

review.title: Service not very good
review.reviewText: I called the reception three times to ask them for a blanket and I am still waiting for it.

review.title: Missed wake up call, missed flight
review.reviewText: Aside from the poor reception and check in, the early wake up call was missed, no reason given and as a result we missed our flight.

review.title: OK, but not very service oriented
review.reviewText: If you are used to staying in hotels which take service seriously you may be disappointed. When I arrived no one paid any attention to me and the 2 large bags I was carrying from a long trip to Asia, and even ignored me as I struggled up the stairs to the hotel (no ramp). Finally someone woke up and decided to help me. Beyond that the place was Okay.

review.title: Conveniently located
review.reviewText: The hotel was easy to locate and just off the highway, and even with its proximity to SFO, the noise level in the room was very low. Rooms are well maintained and stocked with all the necessities of traveling, such as an iron.

review.title: Good business travel hote.
review.reviewText: This is a good hotel to stay in if you are traveling on business. The gym is small but has a decent amount of equipment with a few of outside. The bar is quaint and is a good place to eat if alone.

review.title: Just okay.
review.reviewText: The hotel was adequete but not nice. Not really their fault, it is just not located in a very nice area.

review.title: Would go somewhere else next time
review.reviewText: Was disappointed that this was a Sheraton. Rooms were ok, loud location.

review.title: Airport hotel perfect for short stays in San Francisco
review.reviewText: I liked this hotel simply because of the comfort level and fact that it was located near the airport (with a free shuttle). I had a flight at 6:00 am so there was no way I was going to stay in the city. Keep in mind I do not recommend this hotel if you want to explore the sights of San Francisco, it is too far away and the BART is not cheap and taxis are expensive. One of the staff members was not friendly to me (treated me like I was a kid even though I'm in my twenties) but the other staff members were nice.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: We arrived late Sunday night, and had bad weather (rain). I called the hotel to find out where and when shuttle pick-up was. At 10:15 PM when the shuttle was supposed to stop at terminal 1, it just drove right by us. We took a cab - $12 - and arrived - finally! We asked for a wake-up call at 4 AM, to catch our early flight. The call never came, luckily I had a back-up alarm clock with me. I was disappointed in the overall service - as an airport hotel, the shuttle and wake-up service must function well. Otherwise, the hotel was OK, clean and nice.

review.title: Noisy Air Conditioning, Dirty Used Towels found in Closet
review.reviewText: I paid more expecting quality from a hotel with the name 'Sheraton'. I was a bit disappointed. When I first checked in, I found dirty used towels inside the closet. The air conditioning unit is hard to find. I called front desk and was told I could find the climate control near the door. In fact, the air conditioning unit was behind the desk. When you turned it on, it was so noisy that I could not sleep. I ended up turn off the unit. In the morning around 8:30 am, you can hear noisy vacuuming sound. I can also hear the walking of the occupant in the floor above me. This is definitely not your hotel if you value tranquility! The lobby is not as spacious as most hotels, especially one with the name 'Sheraton'. In fact, to be accurate, it is small. They do have a small restaurant, a microwave near front desk and a small gift shop. You will have your own refrigerator in your own room. Despite no freezer, I found my bottle of water got icy!!! On a positive note, I found the bed comfortable. You have 2 European pillows and 2 American pillows, as well as, a cushion with Sheraton 4-point logo on it. However, a comfortable bed will only give you a good night sleep when the climate control (or air conditioning in my case) is quiet!

review.title: What I expected
review.reviewText: Room is very confortable and spacious, staff was friendly, close to SFO. Just what I'd expect from a 4-points by Sheraton.

review.title: Great deal
review.reviewText: I must admit we were surprised with the hotel. For the price/deal we got - through Expedia - my husband and his family expected a dive. But what a surprise to them all. I wouldn't have expected anything less froma Sheraton property. Although located just off the 101, the noise didn't bother us - we were on the opposite end of the hotel. My sis-in-law did hear the freeway noise, but didn't complain about it. Great location - easy access off the freeway. Easy ride into downtown San Francisco, without the high cost of lodging and parking. Great staff. Very friendly. Would stay here again.

review.title: Four Points
review.reviewText: I was obliged to stay at the Four Points near the SF airport recently. The room itself was fine, had very nice bedding, was quiet, and the hotel provided airport transport the next morning. What I didn't like was the food availability. They have a very small, poor excuse for a resturaunt there, and if I had it to do over I'd stay across the street where there's a Houlihans and Chinese Buffet to choose from. (Crossing busy Airport Blvd is something you'd rather not do on foot.)

review.title: four points rocks!
review.reviewText: the hotel did everything possible to make our stay comfortable.

review.title: OK for price
review.reviewText: For the price it was OK, but nothing fancy. Needs a bit better quality control.

review.title: Convenient Hotel
review.reviewText: I must say that the hotel lived up to our expectations. It was very close to the airport. It was also spacious and clean. I would stay here again for the price.

review.title: Just fine
review.reviewText: This hotel was not fancy but it was certainly a quality hotel for the money. We were on the West side right by the highway on the 3rd floor. Only limited road noise. Staff was helpful. Minutes from downtown, free parking, and a GREAT price through Expedia!

review.title: Very accommodating staff
review.reviewText: I was allowed to check-in at 9am so that I could prepare for a very important meeting the following day. Thanks a lot!

review.title: Don't Bother
review.reviewText: Next to a highway and another busy street, very loud. Not close to anything except the airport and south convention center. Don't bother unless you will be going only to those 2 locations. Room smelled like smoke even though it was advertised to be "nonsmoking".

review.title: Definitely not a bad hotel
review.reviewText: For the price and being in San Francisco, I was expecting something not so great. I was in for a surprise. The hotel staff is awesome. I had a great experience with them. I had my dry cleaning done with them twice. The second time, I wasn't even a guest at their hotel anymore, but my hotel I was staying at made a mistake and told me incorrect information. I called this one again in desperation and they went through the trouble of doing it for me anyway; even if they didn't have to. My room was very clean, and nice. I did face the freeway, so had the noise of traffic, but that was probably my only downside, but not even a complaint. Its within minutes of the San Francisco airport, and has many restaurants within 15 minutes if you have a car. I will definitely stay here again if I am in the area.

review.title: Sheraton four points
review.reviewText: This was just a place to sleep. They do have shuttle to the airport that runs about every 30 minutes. Okay hotel - not fancy tho.

review.title: Good for What I Needed It For
review.reviewText: Stayed for a business seminar at the South San Francisco Conference Center accross the street. The room was clean and comfortable, but the front desk often got their wires crossed and I had to ask several times for the same things. Room Service was excellent.

review.title: Awesome beds. Very quiet. Friendly place.
review.reviewText: very comfortable. close to city.

review.title: Airport Location.
review.reviewText: This property is located next to SFO. I would consider staying here only to catch an early morning flight without traffic concerns. The staff appeared friendly and were helpful. Room has view of Airport Rd. and Hwy 101. We dropped off rental car and were standing at ticket counter within 20 minutes of checking out at 8:00am weekday morning.

review.title: enjoyable
review.reviewText: The Four Points, what can i say, We had an early flight (6am). they worked very hard to get us a room, so we didn't have to wait all day, the one thing i can tell you, is that we never had a bad meal there...( the boy can cook!!!)so come on down, you won't regret it.

review.title: Convenient and comfy
review.reviewText: This is a good place to grab a nights sleep before the early morning flight. Shuttle is free and on time.

review.title: We will stay at this hotel every chance we get
review.reviewText: Loved the beds too

review.title: Was a very comfortable place to stay, good service.
review.reviewText: Good service, nice place, but they should have a complementary breakfest.

review.title: Was a great hotel - overpriced on bottled water
review.reviewText: The hotel was fantastic except for the over priced water. Bring your own bottled water.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: pretty clean

review.title: Not too luxurious
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Very clean and comfortable. Free LAN in each room (wireless in the lobby). (Though the servers were disconnected from time to time. Rather cheap, since out of the city center (near the airport). Free coutesy shuttle to the airport (15 min.) and from there ~25 minutes to the city center by BART (train). Washing machine (coin-operated) inside the hotel. Small GYM with running machine.

review.title: Four Points
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel! Excellent cleanliness, excellent service, very comfortable, ideal area, easy to find! I would definately recommend this hotel!

review.title: Not satisfied
review.reviewText: My recent stay was a disappointment. The noise inside the room caused by the airconditioner kept me awake; the noise outside caused by vehicles didn't help at all.

review.title: Okay ... not great
review.reviewText: Considering location near Highway 101 and airport, this hotel is a reasonably decent place to stay. I didn't have any problems with traffic noise from the highway but that might've been because my room was on the side farthest away from the road. Condition of the romm is alright but not great. Staff was friendly.

review.title: Value hotel
review.reviewText: Comfortable for the money.

review.title: OK
review.reviewText: Fitness room was in very bad shape, otherwise OK

review.title: Not a 4 Star Hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel is supposed to be 4 Star. I'd rank 3 (if not lower). However, the hotel is close to the highway as well as to the Airport.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Nice place to stay with. Nice Staff

review.title: Good airport hotel
review.reviewText: Convenient to airport and not too far from the city.

review.title: if you don't need hot water...
review.reviewText: no hot water, no tissues, previously used lotion, young, inexperienced staff. Decent, but overly priced in-house restaurant.

review.title: Quiet just as promised
review.reviewText: Despite being right next to the freeway, the hotel was well insulated and very quiet. Close to the airport. Two cautions: they consider king bed and two doubles equivalent and the hotel shuttle takes some time as it stops at other nearby hotels on the way.

review.title: had a wonderful experience!!!
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I spent 6 days at this hotel on a trip to the SF area, and we both loved the hotel! Perhaps the best aspect was the refrigerator in the room...the ability to store food and water helped save us a lot of money! The hotel was also very conveniently located right off the 101, and we had very easy access to all the other major highways. We also took advantage of the free shuttle from the hotel to the airport, and from there we could take the BART anywhere we wanted. Overall, the room was clean, and the staff was very friendly. Our room faced the street, yet we never heard any street noise (nor any planes) except for when we had the window open. The bed and pillows were incredibly comfortable, and there was plenty of space in the room for 2 people to move around. Highly recommended to anyone looking for a convenient hotel with just enough frills to make you happy.

review.title: Good airport hotel clean and comfortable.
review.reviewText: Breakfast only so-so not included and overpriced

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: This is definitely one of the best hotels I've ever been to. The staff was definitely sweet and friendly! Service was awesome as well. I left my purse at the front desk and one of the staffs called me upstairs at my room notifying me abuot my purse. What honest and trustworthy people! The price is good for such a nice hotel. However, if you need to get online, please bring a cable with you. (Wireless only in the lounge) Otherwise my stay here was more than pleasant, it was SUPERB! Will definitely stay here again!

review.title: It was perfect for the price
review.reviewText: It was a very inexpensive stay and the quality of the hotel was impressive for the price. I was very satisfied.

review.title: Okay place to stay
review.reviewText: Staff was very friendly and helpful. Room was okay. Good place if just passing through and only need a place to stay for one night.

review.title: SFO convenient hotel
review.reviewText: Clean, comfortable and NO NOISE despite being an airport-convenient hotel.  I was completely unaware of any airplanes and we stayed 2 nights.

review.title: A Nice Hotel for a better price
review.reviewText: Thi is a very nice hotel about 10 miles from downtown San Francisco. The rooms are clean and the service is good. Their advertisements say they have double pane windows to prevent noise from the freeway. Actually, I was a bit hesitant to stay here as I thought there would be a lot of noise. But I guess the double pane windows work fine and there is virtually no noise in the rooms. The heater/AC in the room did not work. They offered to change our room or give us a portable heater. We took the heater and worked just fine. (We stayed there in December). It is just nect to Freewat 101. Take So Airport Blvd exit and it is right at the exit. Overall, this is a very nice, warm and quiet hotel and would definately recommend it.

review.title: Overnighter
review.reviewText: Stayed her with wife overnite between flights on way back to NY from Honolulu to try to break up the jet lag.  Although there for only a short period of time we found the staff very helpful with getting us setup quickly and out quickly the next morning. Would recommend the hotel to any traveler.

review.title: Resort by the airport
review.reviewText: One reason I selected this airport was the advertised double paned windows, to provide a quiet experience at the hotel while it was located so close to the airport.  The hotel is very comparable to any resort hotel I have stayed in. I had several family members arriving at the airport within the two day time period and the location was also very convienent to travel to and from the airport.
